title: What musician has inspired you the most? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s too difficult for me to limit my answer to just one musician. Also, there are a few different categories of musicians who have inspired me to a great degree. Conductors (of symphony orchestras): Michael Tilson Thomas (MTT), Charles Dutoit, Bernard Haitink, Fritz Reiner, Lorin Maazel, Gustavo Dudamel, Yuri Temirkanov just to name a few. One thing I greatly respect about MTT is that not only is he a great conductor, but he is quite an accomplished pianist as well, and he has, on occasion, performed as a piano soloist on stage at Davies Symphony Hall in San Francisco. Pianists: Vladimir Ashkenazy, Zoltan Kocsis, Jeremy Denk, Peter Donohoe, Garrick Ohlsson, David Allen Wehr, Yefim Bronfman, Yuja Wang, Alan Feinberg and several others. Organists: Michael Murray, Christopher Herrick, Simon Preston, Jean Guillou, Peter Hurford, Markus Wargh. Guitarists: Angel and Pepe Romero (pretty much the entire Romero guitar family), Elliot Fisk, John Williams, Christopher Parkening. Composers: J.S. Bach, Ludwig van Beethoven, Sergei Prokofiev, Claude Debussy, Dmitri Shostakovich, Aaron Copland, Ralph Vaughan Williams, Samuel Barber, Robert Nathaniel Dett, and plenty more. In my current “lava lamp of musical favorites”, which ones are currently floating at or near the top this week? Probably MTT (since he’s local), Peter Donohoe (can’t get enough of his Prokofiev piano sonatas 6, 7, and 8), Christopher Herrick (his “Organ Fireworks” CD), and perhaps Shostakovich. But this list could be completely different next month.

I’ll be over the top, and answer your question categorically.. Musicians. What do you consider a musician? Singers? Singer-Songwriters (people who write their own songs?) Producers (the people who make the melodies and the beats.) Singers (Vocalists) 1. Ariana Grande — I don’t care what you think about her.. You must admit her vocals are phenomenal. Forget her lyrics and her songs. Think about her voice.. It’s amazing  2. Florence Welch — a beautiful human being who has the most angelic and passionate voice i’ve ever heard. She has a few hit songs. She’s just amazing, and she sounds beautiful.  Singer-Songwriters 1. Mikky Ekko— He’s a nobody, basically. The only song that’s ever been a hit was Stay, but it was because Rihanna took his song.. But this guy is legendary.. I listen to many genres like R&B, Alternative, Punk, Pop, EDM, Hip Hop, Rock… I’ve heard many artists, but his music is the best.. It comes from his soul, and it’s beautiful. I’ve never heard a song from his that sucked. Definitely give it a listen.  2 Jaymes Young — another singer-songwriter that’s not that popular. He’s amazing. His music comes from someplace real. I’ve never heard a song from his catalogs that isn’t good.  Producers Cashmere Cat—One of the first producers I fell in love with. He makes melodies and beats.. And you might be thinking, how do melodies or beats give off emotion and genuine and powerful feelings? Cashmere cat does it, and he does it so well.  This first one is just an instrumental, but I honestly listened to that on replay— believe it or not.. It is just an instrumental track, but there’s so much latched onto it.. When there’s just music and no lyrics, you’re able to make the song yours. Your able to paint your own pictures and your own feelings, and you attach it to the song. When I listen to this song, I automatically think about my first year of high school. I remember how happy I was, I remember my friendships. I remember good times, automatically, and the song just makes me feel good now. Diplo — The EDM king himself. Under his side project, Major Lazer, he is able to hit mainstream radio time after time, charting all the freakin time.. Under his “Diplo” alias, he is still an EDM legend with many fans— most of which are EDM fans, not mainstream pop music fans..
